snippet: Laws that allow officials to seize assets without criminal charges are too often wielded without care to avoid ensnaring people like Carole Hinders, critics say. A new bill aims to curb the laws’ excesses.
abstract: Federal prosecutors agree to dismiss case against Carole Hinders, Iowa restaurant owner whose bank account was seized by IRS based solely on pattern of cash deposits; she was never accused of any crime.
lead_paragraph: Laws that allow officials to seize assets without criminal charges are too often wielded without care to avoid ensnaring people like Carole Hinders, critics say. A new bill aims to curb the laws’ excesses.

headline.main: I.R.S. Asset Seizure Case Is Dropped by Prosecutors
headline.print_headline: I.R.S. Asset Seizure Case Dropped by Prosecutors
